title: Apex Air Conditioning
overview: The brief for this project was to create a new visual identity system for Apex, air conditioning specialists with over 60 years experience within the industry. The new visual identity system consisted of a range of assets, including a new identity design, website design and bespoke icon library.
commentary: The new identity design combines both the feeling of water and air, reflecting the service Apex provide. A blue colour palette was chosen to embody the perception of cooling, trust and intelligence. Alongside the new website design, a design system was created detailing all key components of the site to aid brand consistency across all existing and future assets. This design library includes icons, typography, colour, UI elements and much more.

title: Woodside Quarry
overview: The brief for this project was to create a planning document for a new housing development called Woodside Quarry, set within ancient woodlands. The document was designed to articulate the correct feel of the development and reflect the idea of a sustainable and well thought out solution to the area.
commentary: A visual language was developed throughout the document, creating its own unique identity system and further reflecting the core values of the development. Large call outs, imagery, overlapping elements and abstract shapes further assist in creating an engaging document for customers.

title: CWFranklin
overview: The brief for this project was to create a new visual identity system for CWFranklin, a freelance web developer from Cornwall. The new visual identity system consisted of a new identity design, website design and UI style guide.
commentary: The new identity design utilises a wordmark with accents of pink on the forward slash and tittle. A blue colour palette was chosen to echo the perception of intelligence and expertise, with an accent of pink evoking a feeling of playfulness. A UI Style guide was further developed containing CWFranklin brand components such as UI elements, colour palette, logo usage, brand application, grid system and much more.

title: BEAU
overview: The brief for this project was to create a brand for a new luxury menswear label. The clothing is directed for the modern gentleman, who appreciates the good quality of life and notices the little details. The brief was to focus on innovation and engineering achievement that Britain has accomplished.
commentary: The logo has been created by reflecting Britain as a whole by the use of a circle and triangular shapes represent engineering as these are commonly used when constructing structures.

title: Workshop Training
overview: The brief for this project was to create a new web design to promote a series of virtual workshop training courses. The aim was to promote the three core courses within an easy to navigate web page and allow users to sign up instantly, hassle free. The design of the page incorporates white space and large image sections with overlapping orange circular elements to draw visual interest and create balance against the content throughout the site.
commentary: A newsletter sign up was also incorporated to allow users to stay up to date with the latest news and workshop courses available to them. The clean and minimalistic design style was further continued throughout the service offering pages, with an ‘enquire today’ call to action within the header section to allow site visitors to book their place on the course. Key information regarding each individual course was also highlighted within the header with additional information available below and via a ‘learn more’ button.

title: Student Charter
overview: The brief for this project was to create a new visual identity and document for Student Charter. The document was designed to outline key responsibilities, expectations and present opportunities to students throughout their time at college.
commentary: The new identity design combines the initials SC from Student Charter within a speech box to embody the perception of communication. A visual language was developed throughout the document, utilising a bright, bold colour palette, evoking a fun and playful design aesthetic with the further addition of colour application to define chapters and key information.

title: OH Design
overview: The brief for this project was to create a new visual identity and online brand guidelines portal for my personal brand OH Design. This central platform has been designed to be used to aid brand consistency for all print and digital applications.
commentary: Yellow has been used as the primary colour within the palette to symbolise creativity and freshness with an accent of blue embodying the perception of trust and imagination to strengthen the brands message. The UI style guide details all key areas evolving around the OH Design brand. This includes the logo, colour palette, font, images, tone of voice, UI elements, brand application and much more.

title: Personal Branding
overview: The brief for this project was to create a new personal identity system. The aim of the update was to create a simplistic, consistent, recognisable and versatile identity that could be used across both print and digital use cases. Included within the visual identity system a refreshed logo and colour palette was created with supporting assets including: Corporate stationery, posters, website design, online brand portal and more.
commentary: The new OH design aesthetic consists of a simplistic colour palette harmonised with a typographic and photographic design style. This concept allows assets to showcase the intricate details.
